announcing the move , tory hq said : signalling the importance she attaches to extending workers ' rights - and ensuring they keep pace with these developments - the prime minister today launches an independent review of modern employment practices .

people with the most severe health conditions who receive employment support allowance , a disability benefit , to be exempt from having to undergo regular health assessments to continue receiving payments .
free training to be offered to adults who lack basic digital skills .
a £ 220m investment to help life science companies and universities develop viable business projects .
a £ 1.3bn investment with bae systems to enable construction work to begin on the generation of submarines carrying trident nuclear missiles .
theresa may became prime minister this summer with voters having only a relatively hazy view as to what her views are .

she had been home secretary for six years but she is something of a political introvert and as a cabinet minister she only gave speeches addressing matters outside her home office brief on perhaps two or three occasions .
during the conservative leadership contest she was all set to elaborate on her thinking during the final stage of the contest .
but then andrea leadsom pulled out , with the result that only one of the series of speeches may was planning , the birmingham economy speech , actually got delivered .
so that is one reason why this promises to be more interesting than the average conservative party conference .
normally , if the party leader is prime minister , we already know quite a lot about them .
this week , and particularly in her keynote speech on wednesday , may has the chance to flesh out her politics and to present herself to the country she runs in a sharper focus .
but there is second issue that will dominate proceedings too : brexit .
over the summer ministers have said very little about how they will proceed with the eu withdrawal talks , beyond the vacuous and tautologicial brexit means brexit '' .
this week , and particularly this afternoon , when the conference holds a session on brexit , may and her team are going to have to say a little more .
equally importantly , conference fringe meetings on the subject are going to give members and mps the chance to set out what their brexit demands are .
overnight may has announced that brexit will involve a great repeal '' bill .
here is the our story on this .
theresa may to propose 'great repeal ' bill to unwind eu laws read more and here is an extract .

may and the brexit secretary , david davis , will use the opening day of the conference to detail plans for their great repeal '' bill that will allow britain to take back control '' of its legislation .
the bill will repeal the 1972 european communities act , which gives direct effect to all eu law , and at the same time convert brussels regulations into domestic law .
this will give parliament the power to un the laws it wants to keep , remove or amend at a later date , in a move that could be welcomed by mps who are keen to have a say over the terms of brexit .
the move is also designed to give certainty to businesses and protection for workers ' rights that are enshrined in eu law .
davis will say : to those who are trying to frighten british workers , saying , 'when we leave , employment rights will be eroded ' , i say firmly and unequivocally , 'no , they wo n't . ' ''
here is the agenda for the day .
9am : theresa may is interviewed on the andrew marr show .
sir craig oliver , david cameron 's former communications director , is also a guest .
the andrew marr show ( @ marrshow ) # marr guests tomorrow : @ twitterid may & sir craig oliver .
papers with matthew parris & @ twitterid + actor @ twitterid .
9am bbc1 # cpc16 10am : chris grayling , the transport secretary , is interviewed on peston on sunday .
peston on sunday ( @ pestononsunday ) all the guests for our # cpc16 special .

chris grayling @ twitterid , sir ranulph fiennes @ twitterid , @ twitterid soubry & @ twitterid 10am itv 10am : priti patel , the international development secretary , and iain duncan smith , the former work and pensions secretary , are among the guests on sky 's murnaghan .

murnaghan ( @ skymurnaghan ) first up on # murnaghan tomorrow - international development secretary priti patel @ twitterid4witham on brexit and foreign aid murnaghan ( @ skymurnaghan ) the view from the backbenches : iain duncan smith on brexit and benefits , and theresa villiers on heathrow and hs2 # murnaghan 10am : grayling and oliver are interviewed on pienaar 's politics .
john pienaar ( @ jponpolitics ) a special pienaar 's politics from # con16 tomorrow at 10am on @ twitterid5live with chris grayling , sir craig oliver , @ twitterid4dales & @ twitterid .
11am : grayling and duncan smith are interviewed on the sunday politics .

robbie gibb ( @ robbiegibb ) join andrew neil and guests live from the conservative party conference in birmingham , 11am bbc1 # bbcsp 12.45pm : liam fox , the international development secretary , is interviewed at a fringe meeting by the huffington post 's paul waugh .
2pm : the conference opens with speeches from patrick mcloughlin , the party chairman , and andy street , the conservative west midlands mayoral candidate .
around 2.30pm : a debate on global britain starts , with speeches from may , david davis , the brexit secretary , patel and boris johnson , the foreign secretary .
if you want to follow or contact me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .
i try to monitor the comments below the line but normally i find it impossible to read them all .
if you have a direct question , do include andrew '' in it somewhere and i 'm more likely to find it .
i do try to answer direct questions , although sometimes i miss them or do n't have time .
alternatively you could post a question to me on twitter .
